basics.name: Chris Small
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: I've been working with C#/.NET framework since beta 2. My focus is on ASP.NET MVC with SQL Server plus client side technologies, and more recently .NET core on Docker/Linux and devops with Hashistack and AWS/VMWare.

work.summary: One of three Principal developers in the Engineering team, the team focus being: improving the platform and exploring and evangelizing new technology to reduce the cost of change.
highlights: Evangelism of the current technology stack, based off an agreed Tech Radar for the year.
Discussing and setting standards in the code base and tools to reduce the cost of change.
Helping scrum teams with implementations of new technology.
Updating and improving the developer interview questions/tests.
My starting role at Totaljobs was Senior developer, working in scrum teams to deliver features to the Jobseeker and Recruiter websites.
Responsible for maintenance of existing webforms based product range, and new ASP.NET MVC 3.0 applications.
Technology stack is based on NHibernate, Sql Server, jQuery, TFS, Silverlight, Visual Studio Team Test/NUnit, Watin/Selenium, Unity and Postsharp.
New product development was run using Scrum and agile methodologies in teams of 3, typically with 30 day iterations, burn downs, daily stand ups, code reviews
My starting role at RICS was mid-level developer

work.summary: LAMP and C#/SQL Server development for Screwfix and Hanson websites.
